page.title: 04VICTORIA HOSPITAL
page.content: Victoria Hospital was built in 1885,a hundred years ago,it was named after Queen Victoria. The hospital has three floors. It is going to be closed on the 31st July 1985 because of lack of money and redevelopment.Nearby residents will miss the hospital because it is over a mile to Oldchurch Hospital. In recent times Victoria Hospital has had no beds, therefore the staff have dealt mostly with out-patients. Many doctors have clinics there, dealing with eye problems, ear, nose and throat, as well as general surgery. Approximately 50 children visit the hospital Tuesdays. Soon Victoria Hospital will be gone and Romford will miss a familiar landmark.
